newsitem.title: UK: BT welcomes UK cable merger.
newsitem.headline: BT welcomes UK cable merger.

text.p: British Telecommunications Plc said on Tuesday it welcomes the formation of Britain's largest cable operator from the merger of the British operations of Cable & Wireless, NYNEX Corp and Bell Canada International.

"We welcome today's moves because they fit in with what we've been saying for the past 18 months -- that there needs to be consolidation among our competitors in this country," a BT spokeswoman told Reuters.
She said consolidation would create a more normal market with players that can comptete with BT on equal terms.
"This will create a market where competition can become the natural regulator," the spokeswoman added. "This is good competition, its stiff competition, but we welcome it."
Cable & Wireless Communications will bring together C&W's Mercury, British cable company Videotron, Bell Cablemedia and NYNEX CableComms, eclipsing Telewest as Britain's biggest cable operator.
BT shares were down 5p at 353p by 1151 GMT. -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717
